topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/555b6672636872520e790300#post_555b6672636872520e790300
You know what's funny?  If you look back on the early seasons of mythbusters a lot of those myths were accepted by the general populace as "facts".


Mythbusters may not be hard science, but this is one of the cases where thought experiments can actually benefit society.  I like mythbusters, cause even though they don't claim to be doing long term scientific experiments in lab settings or that they actually do promote people being interested in science and promote kids to become interested in learning.

If/when I have a kid I'm going to buy them all the seasons of mythbusters, bill nye the science guy and the magic schoolbus.
